title: Tyson Fury admits WWE deal could scupper chances of Deontay Wilder rematch
text:

Tyson Fury's shock foray into the world of professional wrestling could hinder his chances of a mouthwatering rematch with heavyweight rival Deontay Wilder .

Fury's handlers would have preferred to wrap the boxer in cotton wool before an expected second bout against the WBC heavyweight champion in February next year - following their controversial draw last December.

However the Manchester fighter will fulfil a lifelong dream when he swaps boxing for WWE and fights Braun Strowman at the Crown Jewel event in Saudi Arabia.

The heavyweight appeared at a Las Vegas press conference last week where he confirmed he would fight on the October 31 pay-per-view card at the end of a week which started with Fury and Strowman brawling at Monday Night Raw.

(Image: PA)

And the Daily Mail has claimed that his WWE debut, believed to be worth £11.9million to Fury, could be the first of a string of appearances for the American company.

When asked if his decision to switch to wrestling could impact the Wilder fight, Fury replied: "There’s a hell of a chance of that."

Indeed, Fury even suggested he would be willing to take on the winner of wrestling legend Brock Lesnar and former UFC champion Cain Velasquez when they meet on the same card in Riyadh.

He added: "Who knows what lies beneath? Maybe Velasquez, maybe Lesnar."

(Image: WWE/Youtube)

Fury's stature in America rose considerably when he rose from the canvas to achieve a stunning draw against WBC champion Wilder last December, and the pair are set for a rematch next year.

But first, the Manchester-born boxer will achieve a dream later this month when he steps into the wrestling ring.

"I'd like to take this opportunity to say how honoured I am to be here and involved," Fury said at the press conference.

"This is something I've always dreamed of, I'm a lifelong WWE fan and this is a fantastic opportunity for me.

(Image: PA)

"I'd like to say how excited I am to be fighting the monster among men Braun Strowman. But me, being the undefeated lineal boxing champion, I fear no one.

"When I go to Saudi, I am still going to be undefeated, I am going to knock Braun Strowman out.

"He is messing with a guy with the best hands in boxing. He don't want none of them hands."

Undefeated Fury is still recovering from an eye injury that he suffered in his battling victory over relative unknown Otto Wallin in Las Vegas last month, which required around 50 stitches.
description: Tyson Fury has made a foray into the world of professional wrestling that will culminate in a fight against Braun Strowman
